snippet.textDisplay: I remember watching linus grow, as he started with his parking lot unboxings , cause of him i even bough the Silverstone TJ11 case which i still use for my second PC. This guy made it in life he's come from far and he serves the succes he has made. Thank you linus for everything you thought me and the many hours of entertainment .

snippet.textDisplay:
Linus, you probably won't see this but if you do, or anyone else at LTT does, please pass this on.
You do not need to keep pushing like this. You have a fantastic team. Lean on them. How many business owners with 10 million customers still man the tills? NONE.
There isn't a single person in the world that would expect you to do this to the level you do but yourself. You have that drive and passion and you've let it steamroll you. Take a step back... Remember why you started this. We aren't going to stop supporting you because you need time for the rest of your life, give us more Anthony and Jake sso you can step back a bit and appreciate the ecosystem you've made for yourself and the world. You're absolutely correct... If you got hit b a bus, LTT will live on... Don't let that depress you, that's something to be proud of! If I get hit by a bus tomorrow, I have no legacy, I have no following, I have no imprint on this world, I have no kids and I don't think that will change... My 10 years plugging at music has only led me into debt and I think about quitting everyday. But I cannot give up on my dreams. I cannot give up on the one thing in this world that makes me happy in ways human interaction never can.
You have a lot of channels to consider... You should make Tech News something you no longer take involvement in for a start. Your team are more than competent enough to keep flying that flag without you.
You have children, some of them are human, some are YouTube accounts... All children leave home eventually brother, ease the stress and downsize YOUR workload, I am more than sure someone in your team would step up to the palate and be willing and able to manage more of these smaller channels for you. Focus on you, take time and slow down when you need to. You're not a robot... Stop acting like one :)
I hope this reaches your ears.
Take care brother and thank you for all your service. It felt like you were here with me in my front room when I built my first PC.

snippet.textDisplay: Sounds to me like you're reaching a point where you've secured all the basic needs of yourself and your family and now you're in need of a greater connection to your family, yourself (through returning to your own creative loves) and your place in this larger global community. Maybe its time to groom/promote/hire the next "you" so you can take more time with your family and getting (personally) involved in projects/causes of love rather than just the ones that bring in the money.
snippet.textOriginal: Sounds to me like you're reaching a point where you've secured all the basic needs of yourself and your family and now you're in need of a greater connection to your family, yourself (through returning to your own creative loves) and your place in this larger global community. Maybe its time to groom/promote/hire the next "you" so you can take more time with your family and getting (personally) involved in projects/causes of love rather than just the ones that bring in the money.

snippet.textDisplay: Congratulations on your success mate......time to enjoy the fruits of your hard work you most definitely deserve it!
snippet.textOriginal: Congratulations on your success mate......time to enjoy the fruits of your hard work you most definitely deserve it!

snippet.textDisplay:
You are such an inspiration. Your videos were the gateway to me realizing I was interested in computers past just playing games on them and you're a large part of why I'm now going to school for computer engineering. Consumerism aside, the passion you have for what you do comes through in the videos you make. I see YouTubers who get a big head and use their fortunes to live large and then their online persona becomes a total farce, but you've always poured it all right back into your business and kept being the same Linus you always were. Being down to earth is rare these days, and so is having integrity and I think you have never lost those traits, despite being in an industry that heavily encourages you to compromise your values in favor of money.

Focus on your family, they're what's important. You don't owe anything to us.

Being down to earth is rare these days, and so is having integrity and I think you have never lost those traits, despite being in an industry that heavily encourages you to compromise your values in favor of money.

Focus on your family, they're what's important. You don't owe anything to us.

snippet.textDisplay: Please retire Linus. I love your videos, and so do millions of others, but you mean more to your family than you could ever mean to any of us fans. Be there for them. In the end, none of us will matter, just your family and real friends. Don't take a "break", don't go on an extended "vacation". Slow down consistently. I doubt you could stop completely, going from 100 to 0 would make someone as industrious as you go crazy, but put your family first, your children NEED you, your wife needs you. Nothing else matters. I say this as a fan since 2014, rebalancing your life around your family will be worth it.
snippet.textOriginal: Please retire Linus. I love your videos, and so do millions of others, but you mean more to your family than you could ever mean to any of us fans. Be there for them. In the end, none of us will matter, just your family and real friends. Don't take a "break", don't go on an extended "vacation". Slow down consistently. I doubt you could stop completely, going from 100 to 0 would make someone as industrious as you go crazy, but put your family first, your children NEED you, your wife needs you. Nothing else matters. I say this as a fan since 2014, rebalancing your life around your family will be worth it.

snippet.textDisplay:
Linus........ I been watching you for years due to the fact that you are Canadian as am I. You make learning new gear fun and I like the cheese jokes you put in the reviews.
You have been a big help for me deciding to make my career a IT Support Tech. I love working with computers and playing with gear so much that I had my son custom build his first to game on. This was all because of watching your videos.

The story about the kid really hit me hard as being a father of 2 kids......That would have been an amazing and sad experience all at the same time. But to know someone wanted to talk to you shows what you are doing in the world. You have built a company, employee people who have the same look in life towards tech and showing people who are out there and what they have to offer for tech.

You have a company that could run it's self if you have the right person who could stand in front of the camera and explain things the same as you. You have the production team already in place. This would give you more time with the Family and just be the person who over sees everything and put in less hours at work and more with the wife and kids. Doing this would not change your followers, you would still be the same and still grow while being with the family more.

You are a great guy and have a big heart and I thank you for everything you do.
snippet.textOriginal:

Doing this would not change your followers, you would still be the same and still grow while being with the family more.

You are a great guy and have a big heart and I thank you for everything you do.

snippet.textDisplay:
As a tech savvy person I honestly can say that I wasn't your biggest fan over the years, some stuff you do or promote I disagreed with, but I can understand why you did those things - it was hyped, on demand from the audience.
But I'm not writing this comment about that, all I wanted to say is that, despite those disagreements I had with your content, seeing you like this, talking those things- big respect and nothing but respect. I completely change my opinion of you, don't want to sound cheesy here, just wanted to tell you that I completely agree with what you just said, especially since I'm expecting a 2nd kid and I'm too constantly hustling to grow my business.
Glad you figured yourself out, pursuing your passion is always good, big respect once again and good luck.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay:
we took a kid with physical diferences and he wanted to be a cop for a day so we made it happen online. we took the physical issue out of his head for an entire day .
a group took him trained him . he arrested people online and had a blast doing it all. he then said you should work for the make a wish foundation .
i said im from scotland and we are not american . i had to be honest . he knew we were adults and had fun too . he knew his limitations linus .
im sure you do too .we all break a bit from time to time . lots of people dont have a car . or need a car . but for that boy we played with he loved that day .
im sure as an emotional as it was for all of us . it was just as emotional for him . just as 10 million is emotional for you .
well done buddy .

snippet.textDisplay:
Back in high school year 8 we had >120 students. 5 or so were nerds I hung out with who would appreciate your videos. With the scale of 7b on the planet you have >200m to go. If you die tomorrow, you'd be Apple without the Steve.

I've spent over a decade in IT and I get the malaise. My only advice from my own experience is to persue another hobby so you can keep the flame of tech alight.

Do Linus Bike Reviews maybe? Keen to see your opinions on the 2020 R1 :P

snippet.textDisplay: When I look at my EVGA x58 Classified, my HD5870 which was my first ever Gaming Rig, all I can think of is Linus and TigerDirect, who were the ones I watched reviews from. It was back in the day 2009/2010, I was trying to convince my mom to have the money by saying this PC will last for 10 years! And here I am 10 years later with the PC still running. Another story is that I was never into flagship phones but last year I decided to lemme afford my first one. And Linus came to mind. He reviewed the Oneplus 7 Pro and now here I am with the Oneplus 7T Pro McLaren Edition in hand. Both big tech investment I did, Linus was there. Sad to know that for my next one, he won't! :(
snippet.textOriginal: When I look at my EVGA x58 Classified, my HD5870 which was my first ever Gaming Rig, all I can think of is Linus and TigerDirect, who were the ones I watched reviews from. snippet.textDisplay:
You know, what you are going thru is perfectly normal. This line of questioning behind the motivation etc... I don’t have a multi million media corp, but I’ve been working in mortgage sales for 10 years now. When I started, it was just me. i was doing my best and trying to make sales and pushing to be the best to clients as possible and making money to support my familly. I was very good at it, and at some point the workload I was not able to support and still keep the great service I was known for, so I needed to build a team to continue growing the numbers and still keep the service. 10 years later things are doing very well, but the stress is different because now you have people’s lives that depend on how well you are doing. Its not about just me doing the best I can its about providing a living to other poeple too and that is a lot of weight to have on the shoulder of one person.

You starting doing this for shits and giggles and did because you enjoyed it, you prob were not saying to yourself that this will make millions and provide work to tens of people. It slowly turns into this monster where you wake up and go “oh shit, if I fail I have all these people with me thats will end up with no job” so now its not about just having fun.

Just keep on doing what you love. Its what brought you where you are. Don’t overthink it.

Chears mate, love your channel, your team is amazing love to watch you guys.

Chears mate, love your channel, your team is amazing love to watch you guys.

snippet.textDisplay:
Linus, you can't retire... The Verge will become the new goto tech tips place on youtube and the tech world will burn!
But totally understandable. Most of us hit a wall at some point in our career and if you want to retire then do so but don't shut the door, keep it open in case you get the feeling back and want to continue. Take a break and find new roads to explore and if that road makes you happy then continue on it. You made the world a better and easier place to be for us tech geeks who had a hard time in school. Today tech stuff is a common thing to have as a hobby.. and YOU contributed greatly to that

snippet.textDisplay:
linus or whatever you call yourself . go on a holiday for goodness sake you need it . you deserve it .
a long holiday to broaden your horizons . to catch up on all you have been missing other than pc or tech .
so stop complaining ! your young enough to start again and do better but you will lose some time .
but you do need to wind down in your head before you break it . the world will carry on without you linus.
10 million people following you ? some rulers of countries dont have that many people who vote for them !
what have you got to cry about ? like the comedian lee evans go give time to your kids and your wife .
even if you dont quit . why bother telling us when your in charge of your life and bored of it !
kind regards .
p.s. i only watched the first ten minutes of this video to understand you . your are us . your me . your responsible beyond your years.
no shame in that linus .no shame in that at all .

snippet.textDisplay:
Linus if I may call you by your first name? Just a thought from a 58 year old man that lived to work and woke up one day to 2 grown up daughter's that I seem not to be able to remember many of their milestones because I was at the office worried about being able to provide the life I wanted when all they want was dad at their side at these milestones.


Yes do you job be the good boss and CEO that you are, BUT when you family needs you go leave work don't let your love of your job get in the way of memories that you will never have!

snippet.textDisplay: Linus I have been watching you since highschool 2015, you are the reason I built my first gaming computer and found my friend group of fellow gamers. You were a huge part of the reason I went to a tech school to study IT for two years. But, kind of like you, I found I was doing the computer science and tech stuff for the grade rather than enjoying it. The teachers also really sucked, but after those two years, I finally looked inside and realized I was meant to be a teacher. The consumerism of tech today is crazy, I was finding myself spending money on random tech things I would never need when I really should have been saving for college (while in college). The move to elementary education has been amazing, I've learned so much about myself and actually enjoyed doing the work, and I would credit part of my success in life to you, in all my years watching you, you're videos never cease to make the world an exciting place. Thank you and I hope all finds you well, I fully support you whatever you do, if you need time off or need to take a vacation with the kids, do it, your health is more important than anything.
snippet.textOriginal: Linus I have been watching you since highschool 2015, you are the reason I built my first gaming computer and found my friend group of fellow gamers. You were a huge part of the reason I went to a tech school to study IT for two years. But, kind of like you, I found I was doing the computer science and tech stuff for the grade rather than enjoying it. The teachers also really sucked, but after those two years, I finally looked inside and realized I was meant to be a teacher. The consumerism of tech today is crazy, I was finding myself spending money on random tech things I would never need when I really should have been saving for college (while in college). The move to elementary education has been amazing, I've learned so much about myself and actually enjoyed doing the work, and I would credit part of my success in life to you, in all my years watching you, you're videos never cease to make the world an exciting place. Thank you and I hope all finds you well, I fully support you whatever you do, if you need time off or need to take a vacation with the kids, do it, your health is more important than anything.

snippet.textDisplay: I’m a perfect stranger, I started building computers from scratch since 2003/2004 I suffer from depression and a couple months ago I tuned in to your YouTube channel. I haven’t been building PCs lately, I just don’t have time to do it but it made me happy and watching you guys took around in your lab is really really cool. I feel like I’m there with you making mistakes and figuring out solutions just like the old days;) “15 years ago”. I saw the video thumbnail and I imagined you with a gray beard talking tech and experimenting with new stuff. Don’t stop what you’re doing “I’m sure you’ve already heard this but the tech world needs you, I need you; you. Any retire, that’s crazy

snippet.textDisplay: Dude you don't need to "abandon your post" as you say. You can reroute some more of your time to be with your family, that way you can stop putting up goalposts for your wife and actually giving her what she wants, while still making the videos you love. I think going either or is bad since if you were all the time with your family I'm sure you wouldn't be able to sit down for a second as your head would constantly be yanking you to video ideas and all that. That and obviously your long hours may not hurt your family now, but in the long run your kids are going to remember your hardwork, yeah, but they're also going to remember you spending little time with them due to work. It's all about balance, man!
snippet.textOriginal: Dude you don't need to "abandon your post" as you say. You can reroute some more of your time to be with your family, that way you can stop putting up goalposts for your wife and actually giving her what she wants, while still making the videos you love. I think going either or is bad since if you were all the time with your family I'm sure you wouldn't be able to sit down for a second as your head would constantly be yanking you to video ideas and all that. That and obviously your long hours may not hurt your family now, but in the long run your kids are going to remember your hardwork, yeah, but they're also going to remember you spending little time with them due to work. It's all about balance, man!

snippet.textDisplay:
Linus
Don't retire, it sounds good but it's NOT! ! ! Take it from a guy that just retired last February. I lost all track of day hours and night hours, I now usually stay up until 4 AM. The first couple months I just BINGE watched a bunch of shows I liked (Stargate, Stargate Atlantis, Grim, ETC.) Watch a bunch of YouTube videos, and did very little around the house. I started a Consulting company to try to get back on track, quite the learning experience. You would be better off just reducing your hours and take that trip to where you always wanted to go. Don't ruin yourself. Just take a break.
snippet.textOriginal:
Linus
Don't retire, it sounds good but it's NOT! ! ! Take it from a guy that just retired last February. I lost all track of day hours and night hours, I now usually stay up until 4 AM. The first couple months I just BINGE watched a bunch of shows I liked (Stargate, Stargate Atlantis, Grim, ETC.) Watch a bunch of YouTube videos, and did very little around the house. I started a Consulting company to try to get back on track, quite the learning experience. You would be better off just reducing your hours and take that trip to where you always wanted to go. Don't ruin yourself. Just take a break.

snippet.textDisplay: I am crying. I kept waiting for you to say you hopped on an airplane and went to see that little boy in person. I have watched your content on and off for years. snippet.textDisplay:
I almost cried watching 😥
I was jokingly thinking of what my life would have been if I didn't spend those lonely days watching Techquickie... I'm almost sure I watched every single video
I always ask myself who my favourite YouTubers was and every single time Techlinked, Techquickie and LTT just flashed through my mind and I can't say it's one person anymore
Thank you for everything 😔🥺. Whatever you decide to do at the end, Your effort will never be forgotten ♥️
